definition: to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess

sentences.english: Be slow to hire and quick to fire.
sentences.chinese: 招人要慎重，解僱要快速。

sentences.english: It sucks to say this, but everyone cannot do it.
sentences.chinese: 這麼說招人煩，但每個人做不到。

sentences.english: This is the key quality that makes people likable, even to themselves.
sentences.chinese: 這纔是讓一個人招人喜歡，也讓自己喜歡的主要品質。

sentences.english: She is a smart, innocent, and lovely girl.
sentences.chinese: 她是個冰雪聰明的女孩，很招人喜歡。

sentences.english: The 'hate Goldman Sachs' story has been running just too long。
sentences.chinese: 所謂“高盛招人恨”的故事實在是拖得太長了。

sentences.english: I wanted to cry also because I felt tired and his cry was so irritating.
sentences.chinese: 我也非常想哭，因爲我非常累並且他的哭聲很招人煩。

sentences.english: It's recruitment hot at this time of every year, most of company are busy keeping and employing person.
sentences.chinese: 每年的這個時間都是招聘熱，各公司都在留人和招人。

sentences.english: Be slow to hire and quick to fire 4.
sentences.chinese: 招人要慎重，解僱要快速。

sentences.english: He had to find a way to get there, and Dennis's experiment was it.
sentences.chinese: 他需要找到一條路，正好丹尼斯在招人。

sentences.english: The center helps people who have had strokes.
I wish I was special, so fucking special…
sentences.chinese: 俺們也是勉爲其難，誰願意拋頭露面招人嫌呢？

sentences.english: Money is the most envied, but the least enjoyed.
sentences.chinese: 錢最招人羨慕而很少使人幸福。

sentences.english: According to David Rowe, this means that small company managers themselves have to devote more time and energy to recruitment.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着小公司自己要多花時間和精力在招人上。

sentences.english: He was generally disliked and regarded as a pompous ass .
sentences.chinese: 他常不招人待見，而且被看作是個自負的大傻帽兒。

sentences.english: He is not a very quiet man and always wants to be to the fore.
sentences.chinese: 他是個不甘寂寞的人，常想招人注目。

definition: to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
to accept a job offer/to apply for an advertised position
to undermine/to let someone down/to seduce someone away from something
to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy
to do odd jobs/to do unskilled work
to be disgusted with/to dislike/bad reaction/antipathy
